problem.p: An asteroid of mass m is approaching a far away star of mass M following an elliptic orbit. Points A and B in the orbit are at a distance rA and rB from the star. Assume that the mass of the asteroid is small compared to that of the star (m much smaller than M). Neglect the influence of other celestial objects on the asteroid and on the star.
To answer the following questions, type "rA" for rA, "rB" for rB, and "G" for the gravitational constant.
Part 1. Consider the system to be the asteroid:
a. Calculate the work done by all the external forces acting on the asteroid between points A and B.
b. What is the change of kinetic energy of the asteroid between points A and B?
c. If rA>rB, the work is:
d. My answer in part c. makes sense because:

ol.li: as the asteroid is getting closer to the star the kinetic energy increases.
as the asteroid is getting closer to the star the potential energy increases.
as the asteroid is getting away from the star the gravitational force is negligible.
the gravitational work is the only external work on the asteroid.
the result is consistent with the work kinetic energy theorem.
